ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] Freedome For All:) Please Read
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry, this is an EverQuest mailing list and we have nothing to do with any choices made by other publishers.  Though we may at times stray from the topic
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry, this is an EverQuest mailing list and we have
nothing to do with any choices made by other
publishers. Though we may at times stray from the
topic slightly, we do not try to get involved in other
peoples politics. Best of luck in your endeavors.
The undersigned,
PsyKo Marshun


P.S. It is not wise to try to force your way into a
group of society that wishes nothing to do with you,
because it only provokes social anxiety. My advise,
make your own mailing list and quit complaining about
what other people won't do for you.

--- Mari <Magickal-Mari@...> wrote:
> Freedom of Religion Means Any Religion
>
> View Current Signatures - Sign the Petition
> http://www.petitiononline.com/MMoon/
>
> To: The Salisbury Post, North Carolina
> We, the undersigned, are outraged at the refusal of
> a request to list
> a Pagan/Wiccan Study Group - Magickal Moon in the
> Salisbury Post,
> which is located in Salisbury, North Carolina. The
> reason given for
> the request by the FAITH Copy Editor was both
> ignorant and
> discriminatory. "The Salisbury Post FAITH section is
> for people who
> believe in God" and "this is not the image that The
> Post wants to
> portray."
>
> The Salisbury Post's mission statement says in part:
>
> "We are a marketing and customer driven company
> whose mission is to
> inform, educate and entertain. We strive to mirror
> the unique
> communities we serve and offer responsible public
> forum."
>
> We fail to see how denying a Pagan/Wiccan study
> group an equal space
> with other congregations fulfills this mission
> statement. The
> decision was made with personal prejudices and not
> handled with a
> professional demeanor.
>
> Regardless of whether or not Paganism is The
> Salisbury Post's
> religion, it is our religion. The Federal Government
> recognizes
> Paganism/Wicca, as an official religion. Military
> Courts of Justice
> in the U.S. have also found Wicca to be a valid
> religion, deserving
> of protection under the First Amendment of the U.S.
> Constitution. In
> the case United States v. Phillips, (42 M.J. 346) in
> 1995) the
> concurring opinion by Judge Wiss stated: "First,
> Wicca is a socially
> recognized religion. It is acknowledged as such by
> the Army.
> See `Dept. of the Army (DA) Pamphlet 165-13-1,
> Religious Requirements
> and Practices of Certain Selected Groups: A Handbook
> for Chaplains'
> (April 1980), revising A Pamphlet 165-13, `Religious
> Requirements and
> Practices of Certain Selected Groups: A Handbook for
> Chaplains'
> (April 1978). Further, it is acknowledged as such in
> courts of law."
>
> Pagans and Wiccans are a part of your community. We
> are your
> neighbors, your coworkers, your children's teachers;
> we are
> professionals, but most importantly we are your
> readers - your
> customers! As engraved on your building and
> imprinted on the
> Opinion/Editorial page of the paper "The truth shall
> make you free";
> misconceptions about pagans, and being denied access
> to public forum
> makes it all the more difficult for the truth to
> make any of us free.
>
> Due to the fact that this request was handled in an
> unprofessional
> manner and with personal bigotry, we, the
> undersigned, as well as
> members of our family and friends, who are both of
> the Christian and
> Pagan faith will not support The Salisbury Post. We
> will no longer be
> a part of your readership until this matter is
> reconciled with a
> formal apology and the list is made public in The
> Salisbury Post.
>
>
>
> "We are not evil. We don't harm or seduce people. We
> are not
> dangerous. We are ordinary people like you. We have
> families, jobs,
> hopes, and dreams. We are not a cult. This religion
> is not a joke. We
> are not what you think we are from looking at T.V.
> We are real. We
> laugh, we cry. We are serious. We have a sense of
> humor. You don't
> have to be afraid of us. We don't want to convert
> you. And please
> don't try to convert us. Just give us the same right
> we give you--to
> live in peace. We are much more similar to you than
> you think." -
> Margot Adler
>
> Sincerely,
>
> The Undersigned
> http://www.petitiononline.com/MMoon/
>
> Love & Blessings!
>
> Mari
> http://profiles.yahoo.com/magickal_mari
>
>
